page.title: 07THE REVELS ON THE GREEN
page.content: EVERY YEAR IN JUNE THE REVELS ARE HELD ON CROXLEY GREEN. THIS CUSTOM HAS GROWN OUT OF THE THREE CHERRY SUNDAYS THAT WERE HELD IN THE SUMMER IN THE YEARS BEFORE THE 2ND WORLD WAR. ON CHERRY SUNDAYS LOCAL PEOPLE AND VISITORS USED TO GATHER ON THE GREEN TO PICK CHERRIES FROM THE WILD CHERRY TREES THAT GREW THERE AND TO PICNIC AND PLAY GAMES.GRADUALLY THE CHERRY TREES DISAPPEARED AND JUST BEFORE THE WAR THE IDEA OF THE REVELS WAS INTRODUCED.TODAY THE REVELS BEGINS WITH A PROCESSION ROUND THE VILLAGE OF DECORATED FLOATS.MONEY IS COLLECTED ALONG THE PROCESSION ROUTE FOR CHARITIES.AT THE GREEN THERE IS A CENTRAL DISPLAY AREA WHERE THE REVELS QUEEN IS CROWNED. SHE PRESIDES OVER DISPLAYS BY LOCAL ORGANISATIONS. OTHER LOCAL GROUPS PROVIDE STALLS AND SIDESHOWS.
